articles.title: Harden 'just as shocked as you guys' by CP3 news - ESPN
articles.description: Clippers stars Kawhi Leonard and James Harden said Wednesday night they were both "shocked" when they learned earlier that morning Chris Paul would no longer be their teammate.

articles.description: On Wednesday, the Bills claimed cornerback Darius Slay on waivers.

articles.title: Cavs’ flaws exposed again in 122-110 loss to Portland Trail Blazers - Cleveland.com
articles.description: Cleveland opened its three-game homestand with a 122-110 loss to the Blazers. For the Cavs, it’s their fourth loss in the last five games — the latest setback that exposed all of the team’s flaws.

articles.title: Kansas State Wildcats may decline bowl game following Chris Klieman’s retirement - Wichita Eagle
articles.description: K-State athletic director Gene Taylor says the football roster will decide by vote if the Wildcats play a bowl game this season after Chris Klieman's retired.

articles.title: Texas is in pursuit of five-star Ohio State WR commit Chris Henry Jr. - Burnt Orange Nation

articles.title: Siena lacrosse coach Gleason, 41, dies after fall - ESPN
articles.description: Siena men's lacrosse coach Liam Gleason has died, the school announced Wednesday, three days after he suffered a traumatic brain injury in a fall at his home. He was 41.

articles.title: Enzo Maresca reaction — Chelsea boss speaks after mistake-riddled loss at Leeds - NBC Sports
articles.description: Chelsea struggled mightily over 90 minutes at Elland Road, falling to Leeds United in a sloppy, mistake-riddled affair against their newly-promoted hosts.

articles.description: Liverpool manager Arne Slot watched his team fail to assert themselves against a newly-promoted visitor, then saw it go from bad to worse at Anfield.

articles.title: Justin Herbert not practicing today after left hand surgery - NBC Sports
articles.description: Chargers quarterback Justin Herbert is not ready to resume practicing yet, two days after surgery to repair a broken bone in his left hand.
